alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:05PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln County through 345 PM MDT... At 305 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Boyero, or 32 miles southeast of Limon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boyero, Karval, Wild Horse Point and Forder. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
